technologies.name: Null Void Beam
technologies.description: By harnessing the entropic nature of the Null Void, this beam can actually destroy energy.

technologies.name: Entropic Recursion
technologies.description: The universe tends irresistibly onwards and downwards. That tendency cannot be reversed... but it can be subverted, for a price.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Strange Loop
technologies.description: A set of social protocols based on paradoxical intuition, and on love. When we know the System of the Loop, we learn that we can influence by receiving instructions, as well as giving them.

technologies.name: Omega Theory
technologies.description: When a temporal paradox becomes tangled, a kind of consciousness arises, with its own needs, its own desires. This is what has occurred with the consciousness that some call the Worm-in-Waiting. If we can align ourselves with that consciousness, we might just achieve a kind of immortality.

technologies.name: Amoeba Breeding Program
technologies.description: By breeding Space Amoebas in captivity, we can program their symbiotic flagella to act as organic strike craft for our navy.

technologies.name: Star Cracker
technologies.description:
A beam of directed tachyon energy is fired into the star, triggering a supernova. The incredible energy released by this event is then used to generate vast quantities of dark matter.

§RWhen the star detonates, ALL colonies, megastructures, and stations in the system are destroyed - including our own. All fleets in the system will go MIA. The Star-Eater itself is the only exception.§!

technologies.name: Crystal-Infused Plating
technologies.description: By infusing armor plating with Crystalline matter we are able to further increase the durability of our ships' protective hulls.

technologies.name: Crystal-Forged Plating
technologies.description: Introducing Crystalline matter into the forging process further improves the ultra-hard qualities of crystal-infused metals.

technologies.name: Artificial Dragonscales
technologies.description: The Ether Drake's scales are made up of multiple layers of unique mineral nanostructures. Unorthodox manufacturing techniques allow us to closely emulate these self-repairing structures.

technologies.name: Dyson Sphere
technologies.description: A §YDyson Sphere§! fully envelops a given star, converting all solar output directly to £energy£ Energy Credits.

technologies.name: Enigmatic Decoder
technologies.description: While producing average results in standard tests, the accuracy of Enigmatic Decoder's prediction algorithms seemingly increases as the target's flight path grows more erratic.

technologies.name: Enigmatic Encoder
technologies.description: The Enigmatic Encoder scrambles flight path data according to some indeterminable design before feeding it back to fleet command.

technologies.name: Extradimensional Weaponry
technologies.description: Applying 5th-dimensional energy manipulation principles on lower dimensional planes allows for the creation of powerful energy weapons.

technologies.name: Gargantuan Evolution
technologies.description: Voidspawn eggs have evolved to withstand the harsh conditions of space by absorbing and conserving energy from their nearest star.

technologies.name: Genetic Resequencing
technologies.description: No longer will we be limited by the basic biological structure of a species when striving to improve them. DNA is just another material to be shaped as the sculptor wills it.

technologies.name: L-Gate Activation
technologies.description: The L-Gates defy our current understanding of subspace mechanics. This must be remedied before they can be opened for travel.

technologies.name: Matter Decompressor
technologies.description: The §YMatter Decompressor§! lenses a black hole's gravity, forming a drill of gravitational forces to retrieve £minerals£ Minerals from the singularity.

technologies.name: Mining Drone Lasers
technologies.description: Using strong-focus lenses in combination with an oscillating firing frequence help create lasers strong enough to mine asteroids, or shoot down hostiles.

technologies.name: Nanite Repair System
technologies.description: A highly effective hull auto-repair system comprised of billions of microscopic nanomachines was found among the smoking remains of the Scavenger, and has been repurposed for our uses. Whether the Scavenger pilfered this system from an ancient derelict, or was originally constructed with it remains unknown.

technologies.name: Neural Tissue Engineering
technologies.description: When tailored to a species' genome, this form of tissue engineering has intensive neuroregenerative properties, significantly increasing the development of neurons, axons, and synapses in its recipient.

technologies.name: Orbital Trash Dispersal
technologies.description: This orbital bombardment management system spams a planet with millions of minute, high-velocity projectiles, overwhelming planetside defensive grids with trash data. Ships equipped with this component will cause more damage during orbital bombardment.

technologies.name: Numistic Data Modeling
technologies.description: Are the precognitive powers of Numa at work or is it a matter of skilled craftsmanship? Either way this galactic stock market prediction model will forecast fluctuations in the economy with divine accuracy.

technologies.name: Psionic Barrier
technologies.description: These barriers are generated out of pure psychic energy by a cadre of psionic specialists. They will be able to stop some incoming fire, like our Energy deflector systems, but without the prohibitive power consumption.

technologies.name: Psionic Shields
technologies.description: These extremely powerful shields are generated out of pure psychic energy by a cadre of psionic specialists. Their powers are further augmented by large arrays of psi emitters.

technologies.name: Regenerative Hull Tissue
technologies.description: A genetically altered version of silicon-based bacteria could potentially be manipulated to regenerate non-organic materials.

technologies.name: Ring World
technologies.description: A §YRing World§! allows for multiple planet-like zones, cannibalizing all other planets in the system for materials.

technologies.name: Scourge Missiles
technologies.description: By analyzing the biological weaponry employed by the Swarm we can create self-propelled projectiles weapons spreading the very same horrific destruction.

technologies.name: Cloud Lightning Conduits
technologies.description: Void Clouds use the electrical charges generated by the dense gases that make up most of their core to release bolts of burning plasma. Using the same gas composition together with a specialized conduit allows for powerful lightning weaponry.

technologies.name: Frequency Tuning
technologies.description: Adapting the Tiyanki method of siphoning energy from gaseous matter, it is possible to construct weapons draining energy from enemy ships.

technologies.name: Swarm Spawning Pools
technologies.description: Collecting specimens from defeated Prethoryn enables us to clone and genetically program a war-brood of our own.

technologies.name: Industrial Base
technologies.description: The basic industrial infrastructure that is required to become a spacefaring civilization.

technologies.name: Rare Crystal Manufacturing
technologies.description: The crystallization process is complicated and difficult, but synthetic crystals can be manufactured by using specialized industrial plants.

technologies.name: Exotic Gas Refining
technologies.description: Exotic Gas can be produced artificially, but it is a difficult process that requires advanced refinery equipment.

technologies.name: Holographic Casts
technologies.description: Solid holographic casts can alter their shapes at a moment's notice, speeding up alloy production.

technologies.name: Nano-Separators
technologies.description: Nano-separators are a revolutionary new step in the creation of alloys, simplifying the casting process while improving overall production quality.

technologies.name: Nano-Circuit Assembly
technologies.description: With pre-programmed nano-circuits, many consumer products can be rapidly assembled in fabricators.

technologies.name: Replicator Kiosks
technologies.description: These kiosks can replicate any pre-approved object if its pattern has been stored within their memory banks.

technologies.name: Powered Exoskeletons
technologies.description: Wearing a powered exoskeleton suit augments the user's strength and speed. The military applications are obvious, but it will also increase labor efficiency.

technologies.name: Machine Template System
technologies.description: Standardization of assembly templates allow for improved specialization of the drone population.

technologies.name: Binary Motivators
technologies.description: These advanced motivators are both smaller and lighter than previous versions, allowing robotic units to allocate additional space for subsystems.

technologies.name: Mega-Assembly Systems
technologies.description: Advanced templates allow us to drastically increase the assembly of new units.

technologies.name: Nanite Assemblers
technologies.description: Using programmable nanites to assist in the construction of new robotic units will allow for more advanced models that are equipped with an even greater array of subsystems.

technologies.name: Robotic Workers
technologies.description: These robotic work units are perfect for menial labor tasks. They are hard-working and capable of following simple vocal instructions, but should not be expected to climb stairs.

technologies.name: Droids
technologies.description: Upgraded robotic workers, these units have an expanded movement range equal to that of most organics. Their neural processors have also been greatly improved.

technologies.name: Synthetics
technologies.description: Highly advanced robots that are stronger, faster and more durable than the vast majority of organics. With their upgraded neural processors they are fully capable of independent operations.

technologies.name: Synthetic Personality Matrix
technologies.description: Equipped with a personality, synthetics will finally be able to interact socially on equal terms with the rest of our citizens. Some units may even assume leadership roles.

technologies.name: Machine Template System
technologies.description: Rewritable assembly templates allow for the creation of bespoke synthetic worker designs.

technologies.name: Cross-Model Standardization
technologies.description: Improved production practices allow for greater alterations to synthetic workers without compromising core functionality.

technologies.name: Fungible Circuitry
technologies.description: Improved production practices allow for fundamental changes to synthetic workers without compromising core functionality.

technologies.name: Geothermal Fracking
technologies.description: New fracking techniques will allow us to tap into previously unattainable pockets of geothermal resources deep beneath the planet's crust.

technologies.name: Mineral Purification
technologies.description: Optimal processing of mined materials have allowed us to reach new levels of efficiency.

technologies.name: Advanced Mineral Purification
technologies.description: Second-stage processing of pseudo-refined minerals allow for more efficient storage and transportation.

technologies.name: Extraction Patterns
technologies.description: Changes in how mineral deposits are evaluated relative to each other lead to more efficient boring patterns.

technologies.name: Deep Core Mining
technologies.description: These massive drills are needed to access the rich mineral deposits that can often be found close to a planet's core.

technologies.name: Mineral Isolation
technologies.description: Advanced spectrometry combines with fracking techniques and chemical flushing to rapidly exploit shallow and mid-depth deposits.

technologies.name: Offworld Construction
technologies.description: Construction in space presents our engineers with new design challenges that must be solved before we can build orbital stations above other worlds.

technologies.name: Living Metal
technologies.description: Mining and processing the rare living metals is exceedingly difficult, but successful application of the mutable alloys yields incomparable advantages.

technologies.name: Rare Crystal Mining
technologies.description: Mining these crystals without damaging or even destroying them is an extremely delicate process. It requires advanced equipment capable of pinpoint precision.

technologies.name: Exotic Gas Extraction
technologies.description: Pockets of Exotic Gas are rare and often inaccessible by conventional means. Such deposits can only be reached by using special extractor technology.

technologies.name: Betharian Refining
technologies.description: The Betharian minerals appear to have originated from singular source, but were scattered across the galaxy millennia ago. The minerals are most often encountered as pebble-sized clusters, and are highly flammable.

technologies.name: Zero-G Refineries
technologies.description: The addition of internal refineries on mining stations will substantially increase mineral production.

technologies.name: Long-Range Mineral Scanners
technologies.description: Increased scanner range will allow us to more quickly identify mineral concentrations, and focus our mining efforts there.

technologies.name: Mineral Cutting Beams
technologies.description: These powerful short-range lasers can easily slice through rock, making the extraction of minerals a more efficient affair.

technologies.name: Autonomous Mining Drones
technologies.description: Fleets of autonomous drones equipped with mining beams are deployed to quickly and efficiently gather nearby minerals.

technologies.name: Nanite Mineral Probes
technologies.description: These special probes are equipped with swarms of nanites that identify previously unknown mineral concentrations and mark them for later extraction.

technologies.name: Nanomechanics
technologies.description: Advanced instrumentation allows for the study and practical application of physical systems at nanometric scales.

technologies.name: Supersolid Materials
technologies.description: The production and understanding of supersolids are of immeasurable value to any and every space-age civilization.

technologies.name: Superfluid Materials
technologies.description: The study of superfluidity promises to marry quantum mechanics with the fundamental interaction of gravity.

technologies.name: Assembly Patterns
technologies.description: Rapid iteration in construction simulations determines the optimal component assembly patterns for each building project ahead of time.

technologies.name: Construction Templates
technologies.description: Standardized pre-fab templates massively reduce on-site facility construction times.

technologies.name: Assembly Algorithms
technologies.description: The application of game and puzzle theory has the potential to greatly optimize modular assembly and construction.

technologies.name: Weather Control Systems
technologies.description: The ability to alter a planet's weather patterns to suppress destructive weather phenomena will make residential buildings easier to maintain and open up new areas for habitation.

technologies.name: Anti-Gravity Engineering
technologies.description: With directional gravity technology, buildings on the surface of planets can reach higher than ever before without risking structural collapse. The sky is the limit!

technologies.name: Idyllic Architecture
technologies.description: With the latest advances in architecture, landscaping and holographic technology, we shall build the homes of the future.

technologies.name: Micro-Replicators
technologies.description: Microscopic tools that can assist our replication units in creating the more complex circuitry needed for new drones.

technologies.name: Self-Assembling Components
technologies.description: Modelled on organic DNA, these microscopic machine intellects are capable of autonomously assembling most components needed for new drones.

technologies.name: Nanocomposite Materials
technologies.description: Reinforced nanocomposite hull plating can provide an extra layer of protection that could be the difference between life and death in a combat situation.

technologies.name: Ceramo-Metal Materials
technologies.description: A combination of different metals and ceramics that result in a strong armor without sacrificing flexibility.

technologies.name: Plasteel Materials
technologies.description: Plasteel is an elastic material that combines many of the qualities of plastics and metal. It is relatively cheap to produce and can be used to augment ship armor.

technologies.name: Matter Compression
technologies.description: Compressing suitable materials into ultra-dense forms is a cheap and efficient way to improve their ability to absorb weapons-grade impacts.

technologies.name: Durasteel Materials
technologies.description: This strong yet flexible material is capable of withstanding severe punishment. It serves well as ship armor.

technologies.name: Neutronium Materials
technologies.description: This incredibly dense and strong material can resist firepower that would turn armor made of any other alloys into slag.

technologies.name: Ceramo-Metal Alloys
technologies.description: The widespread use of advanced ceramics in industry can improve metallurgical yields.

technologies.name: Durasteel-Laced Alloys
technologies.description: By replacing antiquated ceramo-metal equipment with cutting edge technology, we can run our forges hotter and longer, increasing production.

technologies.name: Flak Battery
technologies.description: Gun batteries that fire shrapnel rounds at close range. They are particularly lethal to enemy strike craft, but can also defend against missiles.

technologies.name: Flak Cannons
technologies.description: Upgraded flak batteries with new, more powerful shrapnel rounds.

technologies.name: Flak Artillery
technologies.description: Predictive tracking algorithms and even more powerful rounds make these batteries incredibly lethal to enemy strike craft.

technologies.name: Chemical Thrusters
technologies.description: Simple yet moderately effective chemical thrusters that rely on combustible propellant to function.

technologies.name: Ion Thrusters
technologies.description: These electric thrusters use beams of ions to generate thrust without the need for propellant.

technologies.name: Plasma Thrusters
technologies.description: An advanced form of electric propulsion, plasma thrusters afford ships greater sublight speeds and maneuverability.

technologies.name: Impulse Thrusters
technologies.description: These highly advanced fusion-powered thrusters provide ships with unmatched maneuverability and speed under sublight conditions.

technologies.name: Dark Matter Propulsion
technologies.description: These ship thrusters utilize Dark Matter technology to generate propulsion in a manner that appears to defy numerous laws of physics.

technologies.name: Afterburners
technologies.description: These powerful thrusters provide additional combat speed but consume a great deal of power.

technologies.name: Advanced Afterburners
technologies.description: This improved version of the standard afterburners provide an even greater boost to a ship's combat speed.

technologies.name: Nuclear Missiles
technologies.description: Space-to-space missiles equipped with high-yield nuclear warheads. Although based on old pre-space technology, these crude fire-and-forget weapons can be surprisingly effective at range.

technologies.name: Space Torpedoes
technologies.description: These torpedoes are essentially very large, slow-moving missiles. They are equipped with more powerful warheads and shield modulators that let them slip unmolested through energy screens.

technologies.name: Armored Torpedoes
technologies.description: Upgraded space torpedoes encased in armor, to better withstand enemy point-defense fire. The armor fragments into shards that cause additional damage when the torpedo detonates.

technologies.name: Devastator Torpedoes
technologies.description: Advanced torpedoes with very powerful warheads. They have a sleeker design, faster engines and upgraded shield modulators for slipping through energy screens.

technologies.name: Fusion Missiles
technologies.description: These updated space-to-space missiles have more powerful fusion warheads and improved flight performance.

technologies.name: Swarmer Missiles
technologies.description: These smaller missiles are launched in volleys and have been specifically designed to overwhelm enemy point-defense systems.

technologies.name: Whirlwind Missiles
technologies.description: New miniaturization techniques will allow us to equip swarmer missiles with more powerful warheads and improved flight performance.

technologies.name: Antimatter Missiles
technologies.description: Advanced missiles equipped with very powerful antimatter warheads. A new and improved guidance system gives them a better chance of finding their targets.

technologies.name: Miniaturized Pre-Igniters
technologies.description: Advances in miniaturization allow for more rapid loading and discharging of rocket-propelled payloads.

technologies.name: Thermodynamic Yield Control
technologies.description: With the chemical reaction tightly controlled by missile-board microprocessors, warhead detonations can be tuned for maximum effect for local conditions at the time of impact.

technologies.name: Quantum Missiles
technologies.description: The latest version of space-to-space missile, this upgraded variant has an immensely powerful warhead that draws its energy from a zero point vacuum.

technologies.name: Marauder Missiles
technologies.description: These highly advanced missiles are equipped with limited onboard AI pilots that substantially improve their performance and ability to track targets.

technologies.name: Mass Drivers
technologies.description: These electromagnetic projectile launchers use magnets to accelerate armor-piercing rounds towards targets at high speeds.

technologies.name: Coilguns
technologies.description: Coilguns are more powerful versions of the early mass drivers, using electromagnetic coils to rapidly accelerate projectiles towards targets.

technologies.name: Autocannons
technologies.description: Large-caliber ballistic weapons that fire cased explosive shells. The main advantage of these cannons is their high rate of fire.

technologies.name: Ripper Cannons
technologies.description: These upgraded rotary autocannons feature improved tracking and fire control systems. This allows them to maintain an even higher rate of fire.

technologies.name: Stormfire Cannons
technologies.description: Advanced rotary autocannons capable of spewing a cloud of high-explosive shells at a target.

technologies.name: Railguns
technologies.description: The latest in electromagnetic accelerators, railguns use twin parallel rails to fire projectiles at incredible speeds.

technologies.name: Loader Efficiency
technologies.description: Minor technical advances combine with improved shipboard routines for handling munitions to provide a noticeable boost in fire rate.

technologies.name: High-Density Munitions
technologies.description: Ultra-dense slugs can punch through even the strongest of projected shields.

technologies.name: Advanced Railguns
technologies.description: A new version of the venerable railgun, with sturdier rails and an enhanced power supply. These weapons are even more powerful and accurate than their predecessors.

technologies.name: Gauss Cannons
technologies.description: This updated version of the old coilgun design is even more destructive than the latest railgun designs. It is capable of launching projectiles with incredible accuracy and speed.

technologies.name: Mega Cannon
technologies.description: An enormous mass accelerator cannon that can only be placed in a spinal mount and fires monstrously powerful rounds over vast distances.

technologies.name: Giga Cannon
technologies.description: An even more powerful mass accelerator cannon that can rip through even the toughest shields.

technologies.name: Kinetic Battery
technologies.description: Very long-range artillery capable of hurling powerful rounds over extreme distances with a large degree of accuracy.

technologies.name: Kinetic Artillery
technologies.description: An even more powerful long-range, ship-based artillery cannon, equipped with a new barrel and an upgraded fire control computer.

technologies.name: Starport
technologies.description: The earliest starbases were little more than makeshift outposts. Permanent starports will enable us to maintain a firmer grip on star systems.

technologies.name: Starhold
technologies.description: As space traffic increases, larger and more defensible starbases are needed to maintain control over system spacelanes.

technologies.name: Orbital Habitats
technologies.description: Allows the construction of largely self-sustaining Orbital Habitats.

technologies.name: Habitat Expansion
technologies.description: Our early habitats were primitive things compared to the efficient designs we can now develop.

technologies.name: Advanced Space Habitation
technologies.description: Years of improvements to our §YOrbital Habitats§! have led us to create newer more effective designs.

technologies.name: Star Fortress
technologies.description: These mighty space forts will provide a focal point for all military activity in a star system, and their presence is sure to deter all but the most stubborn attackers.

technologies.name: Citadel
technologies.description: Plans for an immense battlestation capable of holding its own against several strike fleets are now being drawn up. If realized, these citadels will become monuments to greatness as much as system hubs.

technologies.name: Orbital Rings
technologies.description: Allows the construction of massive, band-shaped starbases in stable orbit around colonized planets.

technologies.name: Modular Engineering
technologies.description: Streamlined starbase construction procedures, using modular designs, will reduce the present build cost and time.

technologies.name: Corps of Engineers
technologies.description: The creation of a dedicated naval engineering corps will greatly benefit the construction of deep space defense platforms, decreasing building costs and increasing durability.

technologies.name: Improved Structural Integrity
technologies.description: A reinforced framework and blast shields with enhanced impact absorption will ensure the structural integrity of the platform even under immense pressure.

technologies.name: Synchronized Firing Patterns
technologies.description: Cross-linking weapon systems to fire in staggered volleys improves the actual damage output of Military Stations over time.

technologies.name: Fortified Core Layers
technologies.description: Additional layers of armor plating within the structure itself improves the resilience of Military Stations.

technologies.name: Carrier Operations
technologies.description: These manned strike craft are launched from a mothership and rely on their speed and small size to survive long enough to punch through enemy defenses.

technologies.name: Improved Strike Craft
technologies.description: The next generation of strike craft, featuring improved avionics, better handling characteristics and more powerful armaments.

technologies.name: Advanced Strike Craft
technologies.description: A further refinement in strike craft design, these advanced strike craft are a pilot's dream. Their performance far exceeds that of previous models.

technologies.name: Heat Recyclers
technologies.description: Circulating excess heat from weapons discharge in order to prime munitions as they are loaded increases the rate of fire of strike craft weaponry.

technologies.name: Synapse Interceptors
technologies.description: Increasing the speed at which fighter pilots can process and act upon enemy positioning data elevates strike craft a few steps up the food chain.

technologies.name: Corvettes
technologies.description: The FTL breakthrough allowed early attempts to adapt traditional surface-to-space shuttle frames to military applications to finally create relatively small, fast, and maneuverable vessels with limited firepower.

technologies.name: Standardized Corvette Patterns
technologies.description: Establishing new standards for the modeling and construction of corvettes greatly improves the efficiency of the production pipeline.

technologies.name: Improved Corvette Hulls
technologies.description: Advances in building techniques will allow for the construction of sturdier and more durable corvettes.

technologies.name: Advanced Corvette Hulls
technologies.description: The latest generation of corvette hulls have optimized structural integrity fields and improved bulkheads.

technologies.name: Destroyers
technologies.description: While larger than Corvettes, Destroyer hull configurations still make for comparatively nimble gunboats.

technologies.name: Standardized Destroyer Patterns
technologies.description: Establishing new standards for the modeling and construction of destroyers greatly improves the efficiency of the production pipeline.

technologies.name: Cruisers
technologies.description: Originally devised as an experimental next-generation colony ship hull configuration, the design's ample hardpoints made it ideal for carrying heavy weapons ordnance.

technologies.name: Improved Cruiser Hulls
technologies.description: Advances in building techniques will allow for the construction of sturdier and more durable cruisers.

technologies.name: Advanced Cruiser Hulls
technologies.description: The latest generation of cruiser hulls have optimized structural integrity fields and improved bulkheads.

technologies.name: Standardized Cruiser Patterns
technologies.description: Establishing new standards for the modeling and construction of cruisers greatly improves the efficiency of the production pipeline.

technologies.name: Battleships
technologies.description: The largest of the standard military vessels, Battleships are traditionally heavily armored and sport several gun batteries.

technologies.name: Juggernaut
technologies.description: A mobile space base of unparalleled proportions, the Juggernaut ship class takes offensive warfare to a whole new level.

technologies.name: Standardized Battleship Patterns
technologies.description: Establishing new standards for how we design and construct massive battleships greatly improves the speed at which they can be assembled.

technologies.name: Mega-Engineering
technologies.description: To complete construction projects of truly staggering scales we must first achieve a fundamental understanding of both the engineering and resource storage requirements for such megastructures.

technologies.name: Mega Art Installation
technologies.description: An artistic beacon on a stellar scale, this installation inspires and represents the spirit of its creators.

technologies.name: Interstellar Assembly
technologies.description: A meeting place for galactic powers, increasing immigration attraction and global opinion of us.

technologies.name: Mega Shipyard
technologies.description: A zero-G construction yard of overwhelming proportion, capable of performing several space ship assembly projects simultaneously.

technologies.name: Strategic Coordination Center
technologies.description: A facility synchronizing the national Starbase network, augmenting defensive and offensive capabilities.

technologies.name: Quantum Catapult
technologies.description: A §YQuantum Catapult§! harnesses the power of a Neutron Star or Pulsar to twist the fabric of space, skipping a fleet across great distances.

technologies.name: Sentry Array
technologies.description: The stages of the §YSentry Array§! gradually expand sensor range, eventually covering the entire galaxy.

technologies.name: Science Nexus
technologies.description: The research labs and databanks of a §YScience Nexus§! generate an immense flow of raw, undiluted science.

technologies.name: Titans
technologies.description: Modeled after the hulking shadows looming in the core systems of Stagnant Ascendancies, the Titan class can be outfitted with X-size weapons.

technologies.name: Colossi
technologies.description: Advances in mega-engineering make blur the lines between reality and the fantastical, enabling the construction of Colossus-class military vessels that carry weapons capable of obliterating - or fundamentally altering - entire worlds, with the push of a button.

technologies.name: Atmospheric Nanobot Dispersal
technologies.description: Nanobot Diffuser

technologies.name: Core Cracking
technologies.description: A directed feed of thermic energy superheats the atmosphere and agitates the planet's core, setting up disastrous tectonic events. A final and comparatively minute concussive blast is then delivered, cracking the planet open.

technologies.name: Divine Stimulus
technologies.description: An arcane catalyst amplifying certain psionic wavelengths, capable of inducing hallucinations (religious experiences) in biological brains, and severe disruption (brain death) in electronic ones.

technologies.name: Neutron Sweeping
technologies.description: An accelerated plume of neutron radiation "paints" the planet surface, severely degrading most materials and directly destroying biological tissue.

technologies.name: Global Pacification
technologies.description: A shielding field is deployed around a planet, creating a barrier that is permanent and impenetrable (save for some wavelengths of light).

technologies.name: Improved Titan Hulls
technologies.description: Advances in building techniques will allow for the construction of sturdier and more durable titans.

technologies.name: Advanced Titan Hulls
technologies.description: The latest generation of titan hulls have optimized structural integrity fields and improved bulkheads.

technologies.name: Improved Battleship Hulls
technologies.description: Advances in building techniques will allow for the construction of sturdier and more durable battleships.

technologies.name: Advanced Battleship Hulls
technologies.description: The latest generation of battleship hulls have optimized structural integrity fields and improved bulkheads.

technologies.name: Improved Destroyer Hulls
technologies.description: Advances in building techniques will allow for the construction of sturdier and more durable destroyers.

technologies.name: Advanced Destroyer Hulls
technologies.description: The latest generation of destroyer hulls have optimized structural integrity fields and improved bulkheads.

technologies.name: Mechanized Mining
technologies.description: The application of mechanical engineering to mineral extraction is a fundamental requirement for any industrial society.

technologies.name: Nanite Transmutation
technologies.description: The mass-production of these rare resources require particularly capable nanites.

technologies.name: Space Exploration
technologies.description: The realization of faster-than-light travel is a new dawn for space exploration. Manned missions to other star systems are now not only possible, but necessary.

technologies.name: Orbital Energy Conversion
technologies.description: Advances in solar panel technology could offset the operating costs of our starbases. The panels would require an entire starbase module to generate enough energy, however.

technologies.name: Starbase Construction
technologies.description: A centralized space installation built in close orbit around the system primary is necessary to make full use of the resources in a star system.

technologies.name: Deep Space Defenses
technologies.description: This will enable the construction of defensive deep space platforms to protect our Starbases.

technologies.name: Interplanetary Expeditionary Forces
technologies.description: The invasion of another world is a staggering enterprise. There are immense logistical challenges that must be overcome before we can muster our first interplanetary armies.

technologies.name: L-Gate Insight
technologies.description: Intensive study within the fields of nanomachinery and subspace phenomena will eventually yield a new §YL-Gate Insight§! into the Disabled L-Gate mystery.

technologies.name: Active Countermeasures
technologies.description: The best defense is a good offense.

technologies.name: Interlinked Support Systems
technologies.description: Arrays of defensive armaments prove much more effective than independent countermeasures.

technologies.name: Predictive Algorithms
technologies.description: Advanced prediction greatly increases the accuracy of active countermeasure systems.

technologies.name: Scientific Method
technologies.description: Testable predictions of observable phenomena.

technologies.name: Exotic Materials Labs
technologies.description: As we explore the galaxy, we continually encounter new materials and substances that are unfamiliar to us. Cataloging and analyzing these discoveries will require new facilities.

technologies.name: Multi-Dimensional Studies
technologies.description: To expand our knowledge base, we must consider all levels of existence. A new realm of science awaits us!

technologies.name: Interplanetary Research Initiative
technologies.description: A bid for interplanetary resource pools and more flexible research grants.

technologies.name: Administrative AI
technologies.description: Organizational circuitry rerouting academic fervor.

technologies.name: Self-Evolving Logic
technologies.description: Introspective prioritization.

technologies.name: Synchronized Defenses
technologies.description: Aligning defensive and offensive weapon execution paradigms allows for increased efficiency.

technologies.name: Positronic AI
technologies.description: Evolving artificial intellects are opening the door to the possibility for true synthetic sapience.

technologies.name: Positronic Implants
technologies.description: Expanding possibilities through the application of limited cybernetics.

technologies.name: Market Analysis Algorithms
technologies.description: Basic administrative AIs can be used to streamline supply and demand lines, reducing waste.

technologies.name: Predictive Consumerism
technologies.description: Using advanced AIs, we can reliably predict consumer demand before it exists.

technologies.name: AI-Controlled Colony Ships
technologies.description: By giving control of the colony ship to an Artificial Intelligence, the crew and colonists can be suspended in a deep sleep.

technologies.name: Self-Aware Colony Ships
technologies.description: Sufficiently advanced systems are capable of optimizing themselves if they are made acutely aware of the purpose for which they were made.

technologies.name: Specialized Combat Computers
technologies.description: Active matrices tuned for specific combat-centric tasks greatly improve engagement efficiency.

technologies.name: Extended Combat Algorithms
technologies.description: Further advances in predictive algorithms allow for augmented tactical decision-making in the field.

technologies.name: Autonomous Ship Intellects
technologies.description: Granting our ships their own semi-autonomous intellect will greatly enhance their responsiveness in combat.

technologies.name: Sapient Combat Simulations
technologies.description: Running sapient AIs through high-intensity combat simulations yields valuable insight into potential optimizations for risk-evaluation techniques.

technologies.name: Auxiliary Fire-control
technologies.description: By installing an auxiliary fire-control system our ships can afford to make more advanced calculations, increasing accuracy.

technologies.name: Zero-G Laboratories
technologies.description: A lot of critical research can only be done in a zero gravity environment, which these specialized laboratories are eminently designed for.

technologies.name: Miniature Containment Fields
technologies.description: Containment force fields are excellent for isolating and holding various substances or specimens so they can be analyzed in detail.

technologies.name: Quantum Probes
technologies.description: Advanced probes that can thoroughly analyze subjects on a sub-atomic level, generating a wealth of valuable research data.

technologies.name: Autonomous Station Protocols
technologies.description: Increased automation of station functions will free up more staff for research duties.

technologies.name: Multi-Dimensional Analysis
technologies.description: Studying something from the limited perspective of a single dimensional reality does not paint the whole picture. Every angle must be considered.

technologies.name: Quantum Theory
technologies.description: Exploring the mediation of fundamental forces through subatomic particles.

technologies.name: Applied Quantum Physics
technologies.description: The seemingly erratic behavior of tiny things can dramatically alter the way we think about bigger things.

technologies.name: Gravitational Analysis
technologies.description: Increasingly powerful computation paradigms allow us to adapt individual construction projects to planetary and ultra-local gravitational conditions.

technologies.name: Space-Time Theory
technologies.description: Three dimensions, inextricable from the fourth.

technologies.name: Quantum Hacking
technologies.description: Primitive encryption systems stand no chance against modern decryption tools.

technologies.name: Simulated Social Engineering
technologies.description: The weakest link in any security system are the individuals within it. By modeling their weaknesses in computer simulations we can find novel ways to bypass their security - or trick them into bypassing it for us.

technologies.name: Quasi-Dimensional Reflection
technologies.description: Our operatives can access data from adjacent realities without risking setting off alarms in this reality.

technologies.name: Quantum Firewalls
technologies.description: Advances in computing technology have given us new ways to protect our data from prying eyes.

technologies.name: Simultaneous-Collapse Storage
technologies.description: Further advances in unstable entanglement have given us new ways to prevent unauthorized intrusions into our databases.

technologies.name: Negative-Time Keys
technologies.description: Our latest advances in encryption exploit recently discovered quirks of physics to require inputting a specialized key before it has been generated.

technologies.name: Gravitic Sensors
technologies.description: These sensors have been tuned to look for any gravitational changes in space, such as those produced by the presence of a starship.

technologies.name: Speculative Hyperlane Breaching
technologies.description: Solitary Science Ships can break out of the naturally-occurring hyperlanes and attempt to navigate to known but otherwise unreachable destinations.

technologies.name: Subspace Sensors
technologies.description: Sensors that detect the subspace fluctuations left in the wake of traveling starships. Their sensitivity and range is greater than that of a gravitic sensor array.

technologies.name: Tachyon Sensors
technologies.description: Advanced sensors that rely on rotating tachyon beams to detect ship movements even at extreme distances.

technologies.name: Dark Matter Drawing
technologies.description: This exotic substance has many properties that seemingly defy the laws of physics. Harvestable concentrations can only be found near Black Holes or in certain nebulas.

technologies.name: High-Energy Capacitors
technologies.description: Capacitors capable of storing vast amounts of energy is one of the cornerstones for any modern civilization.

technologies.name: Global Energy Management
technologies.description: Load-balancing facilities can greatly improve the stability of local grids and feed excess power back into centralized capacitors.

technologies.name: Planetary Power Grid
technologies.description: A re-engineered and unified grid further reduces energy losses over distance.

technologies.name: Field Modulation
technologies.description: Modulated fields allow for increased production and improved energy yield.

technologies.name: Quantum Energy States
technologies.description: Basic entanglement principles applied to energy generation provide a substantial increase in energy output.

technologies.name: Applied Superconductivity
technologies.description: Minor improvements to transmission efficiency adds up to a sizeable reduction in overall energy loss.

technologies.name: Quantum Field Manipulation
technologies.description: Quantum superposition of energy coils, simultaneously drained and charged.

technologies.name: Deflectors
technologies.description: Energy deflector screens can stop a limited amount of incoming enemy fire before overloading. Their main drawback is that they consume large amounts of power.

technologies.name: Improved Deflectors
technologies.description: These updated deflector screens are capable of soaking up even more punishment before they overload.

technologies.name: Shields
technologies.description: These new shield generators represent the next generation of energy screens, replacing the older deflector technology. They offer significantly better protection.

technologies.name: Planetary Shields
technologies.description: Generating a strong energy shield within a planetary atmosphere is a greater challenge than in the vacuum of space, but it offers a potent defense against orbital bombardment.

technologies.name: Shield Capacitors
technologies.description: These capacitors store surplus energy which can quickly be transferred to reinforce a ship's shields.

technologies.name: Advanced Shields
technologies.description: An updated shield generator that produces an even stronger energy field. Only sustained enemy fire can penetrate this barrier.

technologies.name: Shield Harmonics
technologies.description: The basic mechanics of ship shields are complex, but they can be adjusted and improved in a multitude of ways.

technologies.name: Hyper Shields
technologies.description: These reinforced and hardened energy shields are incredibly powerful. The protection they offer is second to none.

technologies.name: Dark Matter Deflectors
technologies.description: These deflectors utilize dark matter to deflect incoming projectiles in a way that seems to utterly defy the laws of nature.

technologies.name: Red Lasers
technologies.description: Laser weapons fire focused beams of light at targets, causing damage through the generation of intense heat.

technologies.name: Blue Lasers
technologies.description: More powerful than red lasers, these blue variants emit electromagnetic radiation at a wavelength that appears blue or violet to most organics.

technologies.name: Flash Coolant
technologies.description: New developments in tech cooling regularly surface, improving the stability and efficiency of our weapons systems, keeping them from blowing up the ships upon which they are mounted.

technologies.name: Plasma Throwers
technologies.description: Weapons that eject destructive balls of high-energy plasma at targets. These plasma projectiles are extremely effective at eating through ship armor.

technologies.name: Plasma Accelerators
technologies.description: These new accelerators launch projectiles of high-energy plasma with improved containment fields. This results in less energy leakage as the projectile travels in space towards its target.

technologies.name: Plasma Cannons
technologies.description: The latest in plasma weaponry, these cannons are fully militarized versions of the older, somewhat improvised plasma throwers. Their plasma projectiles are even deadlier.

technologies.name: Disruptors
technologies.description: Disruptors fire high-energy bolts that weaken and destroy the molecular bonds that hold the target's constituent atoms together. They are capable of passing through shields and armor to wreak havoc directly on enemy hull and crew.

technologies.name: Ion Disruptors
technologies.description: These upgraded disruptors fire bolts of more destructive ion particles at targets.

technologies.name: Phase Disruptors
technologies.description: Extremely high-yield disruptors that fire quantum energy charges causing incredible damage to those unfortunate enough to get in their way.

technologies.name: Arc Emitters
technologies.description: Powerful weapons that launch a lightning arc of chaotic energy at targets, which in part can ignore armor and shields.

technologies.name: Focused Arc Emitters
technologies.description: These upgraded emitters are equipped with better focusing lenses, resulting in a more powerful energy discharge.

technologies.name: UV Lasers
technologies.description: Ultraviolet lasers are an updated and more powerful version of their blue predecessors. Accurate and destructive, these weapons are capable of inflicting great damage.

technologies.name: X-Ray Lasers
technologies.description: These lasers have a shorter wavelength than UV-based laser weaponry, but are even more destructive.

technologies.name: Focusing Arrays
technologies.description: Perfecting the firing cadence of laser weaponry is a task that could keep the engineering elite of any given planet busy for centuries.

technologies.name: Particle Lances
technologies.description: These heavy energy weapons fire focused particle beams that cause massive damage. The size of the emitter arrays limits their use to battleships and titans.

technologies.name: Tachyon Lances
technologies.description: A more powerful version of the particle lance, this weapon fires a tachyon beam of immense power. Like its predecessor, its use is limited to battleships and titans.

technologies.name: Gamma Lasers
technologies.description: The electromagnetic radiation emitted by gamma lasers is of an extremely high frequency. Their destructive potential is unmatched in the field of laser weapons.

technologies.name: Proton Launchers
technologies.description: These energy projectiles consist of tightly concentrated protons capable of causing immense damage to the hull of enemy ships.

technologies.name: Neutron Launchers
technologies.description: Upgraded energy projectiles that rely on neutrons instead of protons for their destructive power.

technologies.name: Fission Power
technologies.description: This energy source generates power for ships through induced fission, but it also produces harmful nuclear waste.

technologies.name: Fusion Power
technologies.description: Nuclear fusion processes generate a great amount of power for ships, but without many of the risks associated with fission power.

technologies.name: Cold Fusion Power
technologies.description: The ability to sustain a fusion reaction at relatively low temperatures will result in a new generation of fusion reactors for our ships.

technologies.name: Antimatter Power
technologies.description: By harnessing the energy produced by matter/antimatter annihilations, our efficiency at generating ship power will be orders of magnitude better than fusion.

technologies.name: Zero Point Power
technologies.description: These generators extract vacuum energy, providing an almost limitless supply of ship power. There is no more efficient way to generate energy.

technologies.name: Dark Matter Power
technologies.description: These generators appear to somehow draw energy directly from dark matter, providing more ship power than should be possible according to the laws of physics.

technologies.name: Jump Drive
technologies.description: A groundbreaking technological marvel, the Jump Drive shreds the local space-time continuum and rearranges it on the quantum level to be identical to that of the target destination - and thus the ship appears to near-instantly "jump" from system to system.

technologies.name: Reactor Boosters
technologies.description: Additional power generation systems increase the ship's reactor output.

technologies.name: Improved Reactor Boosters
technologies.description: The discovery of fusion power allows for better reactor boosters to be fitted onto our ships.

technologies.name: Advanced Reactor Boosters
technologies.description: The discovery of antimatter power allows for highly advanced reactor boosters that can greatly enhance ship reactors.

technologies.name: Hyperspace Travel
technologies.description: Like the strands of a spider web, the extra-dimensional realm of hyperspace runs between the gravity wells of most stars. Faster than light travel is theoretically possible along these hyperlanes.

technologies.name: FTL Inhibition
technologies.description: Gravity well projectors can be used to create localized pockets of space where safe entry into hyperspace is impossible. The immense power requirements and the size of the projectors prohibits their use on anything smaller than a starbase.

technologies.name: Hyperlane Breach Points
technologies.description: We have identified the existence of points in space where a ship expends less energy to "breach" their way into a hyperlane. This will lead to a new generation of hyper drives.

technologies.name: Wormhole Stabilization
technologies.description: A naturally occurring subspace wormhole is a fickle thing, and its fluctuating energy levels typically make it impossible to travel safely between its linked apertures. There are ways to temporarily stabilize its matrix, however.

technologies.name: Hyper Relays
technologies.description: §YHyper Relays§! form a chain of structures built outside the gravity well of systems, allowing fast travel from relay to relay rather than requiring transit to established hyperlane entrances.

technologies.name: Hyperspace Slipstreams
technologies.description: A new generation of hyper drives capable of accessing the subspace slipstreams that are present within hyperspace. This leads to dramatically improved drive performance.

technologies.name: Gateway Activation
technologies.description: The ability to reactivate the derelict Gateway stations that can be found scattered throughout the galaxy has the potential to dramatically shorten travel times.

technologies.name: Gateway Construction
technologies.description: The construction of new Gateway stations enables us to build a fast-travel network that could revolutionize interstellar travel.

technologies.name: Automated Exploration Protocols
technologies.description: An advanced AI will aid science officers in their task to explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life and new civilizations, to boldly go where no Blorg has gone before. The Science Ship will be able to explore the galaxy with help from an AI.

technologies.name: Curator Archaeology Lab
technologies.description: A shipboard lab with advanced archaeological equipment, including a vast database supplied by the Curator Order where new discoveries can easily be cross-referenced.

technologies.name: Curator Archaeology Lab
technologies.description: A shipboard lab with advanced archaeological equipment, including a vast database supplied by the Curator Order where new discoveries can easily be cross-referenced.

technologies.name: Curator Exploration Lab
technologies.description: These shipboard lab facilities incorporate advanced technologies from the ancient Curator Order to further increase survey speeds.

technologies.name: Bio-Reactor
technologies.description: A facility where organic matter is converted into energy at a highly efficient rate.

technologies.name: Mote Stabilization
technologies.description: Volatile Motes are fickle particles that are dangerous to work with. In order to safely harvest them without setting off a chain-reaction of explosions, energy fields must be used to stabilize the motes.

technologies.name: Volatile Material Plants
technologies.description: Aside from the obvious safety concerns, the artificial creation of Volatile Motes is an extremely delicate and complicated process that requires highly specialized equipment.

technologies.name: Industrial Agriculture
technologies.description: Large-scale industrial farms growing nutrient-rich produce allows a civilization to grow its population manifold.

technologies.name: Hydroponics Farming
technologies.description: Hydroponics Farming in a controlled environment allows for crops to be grown in climates where farming would normally be impossible.

technologies.name: Eco Simulation
technologies.description: Farming techniques can be further refined through sophisticated computer simulations of different environments and weather patterns. This allows for more predictable crop yields.

technologies.name: Gene Crops
technologies.description: Sophisticated genetic engineering of crops helps increase yield and further improves both taste and nutrient levels.

technologies.name: Transgenic Crops
technologies.description: Transgenic crops offer the nutritional elements of several standard food crops in one convenient package.

technologies.name: Nano-Vitality Crops
technologies.description: Infusing crop strands with small amounts of nano-machines help create a type of produce that is ultra resilient, and the chemical composition of which can be tailored and altered during its entire lifetime.

technologies.name: Nutrient Replication
technologies.description: The process of synthetically replicating crops requires a lot of collected waste to create a small amount of produce, but nevertheless provides a significant boost to agricultural output.

technologies.name: Food Processing
technologies.description: Improved food processing techniques will lead to better preservation methods and less spoilage.

technologies.name: Advanced Food Processing
technologies.description: New cryopreservation and protein resequencing methods will make food processing much more efficient.

technologies.name: Genome Mapping
technologies.description: Mapping the genome of an individual through the sequencing of their DNA opens up for tailored medical treatments and therapies.

technologies.name: Cloning
technologies.description: Breakthroughs in enucleation and artificial womb technology allows for the mass-production of individuals based on a common genetic template.

technologies.name: Gene Banks
technologies.description: Gene Banks filter and curate available genomes for deployment in clones.

technologies.name: Epigenetic Triggers
technologies.description: Advanced DNA methylation techniques allow for functionally significant alterations to be made to arbitrary genomes.

technologies.name: Morphogenetic Field Mastery
technologies.description: From its cradle as a purely pharmaceutical venture, advancements in our understanding of the morphogenetic field allow for direct, subconscious interfaces with organic units.

technologies.name: Genetic Healthcare
technologies.description: The colonization of alien worlds has opened up an entirely new field of biomedical research.

technologies.name: Cyto-Revitalization
technologies.description: As our empire grows, so does our understanding of our own biology. Advanced medical treatments on a cellular level have allowed for significant advancements in population health.

technologies.name: Gene Tailoring
technologies.description: Making gene-editing tools widely available is sure to have a positive impact on our development as a species.

technologies.name: Gene Seed Purification
technologies.description: Nucleotide purification techniques allow for the isolation and refinement of particularly desirable genetic traits.

technologies.name: Targeted Gene Expressions
technologies.description: Stricter control of RNA and protein production on the cellular level.

technologies.name: Glandular Acclimation
technologies.description: Through glandular biological tailoring we can change the environmental tolerance of a species to suit our needs.

technologies.name: Subdermal Stimulation
technologies.description: Deep-tissue implants are the latest innovation in the revolutionary overlapping of sensory engineering and entertainment experiences. "Where we're going, we won't need skin to feel!"

technologies.name: Tracking Implants
technologies.description: Further advancements in the field of subdermal implants can provide detailed information regarding the movements and actions of the implanted.

technologies.name: Vitality Boosters
technologies.description: Where the body fails, science intervenes.

technologies.name: Cell Revitalization
technologies.description: Regimens of periodic cell revitalization treatments keep the leader class spry and active beyond traditionally expected lifespans.

technologies.name: Selected Lineages
technologies.description: Careful reproductive planning should be incentivized, lest we waste valuable genetic legacies.

technologies.name: Capacity Boosters
technologies.description: We leave nothing to chance, no matter the cost. Through exacting curation of DNA banks do we build the leaders of tomorrow.

technologies.name: Biodiversity Studies
technologies.description: Studying the different forms of life that appear on our world helps us better understand ourselves and the life that surrounds us.

technologies.name: Xenobiology
technologies.description: Studying the life that arises on other worlds and beyond allows us to understand fundamental aspects of biology that were previously beyond our reach.

technologies.name: Arcane Deciphering
technologies.description: Various artifacts and technologies functioning by arcane means that cannot be understood or replicated... at least not by conventional science as it is known to us.

technologies.name: Secrets of Life
technologies.description: Having the opportunity to study the multitudes of life lets us find some common ground for all living beings. The foundational building blocks of life.

technologies.name: Planetary Defenses
technologies.description: There may come a time when intellects, vast and cool and unsympathetic, regard our worlds with envy and draw plans against us. We must be ready.

technologies.name: Ground Defense Planning
technologies.description: There are many alien empires who would gladly seize our worlds for themselves. We must be prepared for them, should the worst come to pass.

technologies.name: Global Defense Grid
technologies.description: The strategic value of a good defense remains as relevant today as it was to our predecessors in the far distant past. Technology does not render fortifications obsolete - it merely changes their requirements.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Space Combat
technologies.description: Gradual adaptation to the realities of deep-space combat allows us to effectively coordinate larger maneuvers.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Reactive Formations
technologies.description: Gradual adaptation to the realities of deep-space combat allows us to effectively coordinate larger maneuvers.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Interstellar Warfare
technologies.description: Gradual adaptation to the realities of deep-space combat allows us to effectively coordinate larger maneuvers.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Fluid Fleet Templates
technologies.description: Gradual adaptation to the realities of deep-space combat allows us to effectively coordinate larger maneuvers.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Armada Battle Formation
technologies.description: Gradual adaptation to the realities of deep-space combat allows us to effectively coordinate larger maneuvers.

technologies.name: Admiralty Support Staff
technologies.description: Improving the support staff available to our admirals will increase the number of ships they can command in a single fleet.

technologies.name: Centralized Command
technologies.description: Creating dedicated headquarters for all levels of military operations shapes an efficient fleet, and lays a better foundation for future military training.

technologies.name: Combat Training
technologies.description: A more extensive training program for new recruits, including realistic combat scenarios, prepare them for the field.

technologies.name: Nerve Dampeners
technologies.description: Careful tuning of pain receptors allow soldiers to fight through what would previously have been debilitating injuries.

technologies.name: Aggressive Conditioning
technologies.description: Iterating on the standard conditioning regimen for ground troops has proven to make them more effective in direct combat.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Fleet Support
technologies.description: As extrasolar expeditions become more common, it is important to provide planetside relief for returning fleets.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Support Vessels
technologies.description: A fleet does not run on zeal alone. To ensure steady access to critical supplies, we should organize our logistics corps into dedicated support vessels.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Interstellar Logistics
technologies.description: Amateurs talk about tactics. Professionals study logistics. By ensuring our fleets are regularly and efficiently supplied, we can increase the number of vessels we can effectively support.

technologies.name: Doctrine: Fleet Liasions
technologies.description: By maintaining a professional corps of fleet liasions, we can improve communications and the flow of orders throughout the chain of command.

technologies.name: Fleet Management Procedures
technologies.description: Improved fleet management procedures will free up the resources needed to maintain a bigger fleet.

technologies.name: Adaptive Combat Algorithms
technologies.description: Organics often fight using illogical and unpredictable tactics that can be difficult to effectively counter. Adaptive tactics and new, more maneuverable warforms should provide a decisive advantage.

technologies.name: Biomechanics
technologies.description: Millions of years of organic evolution will sometimes, through sheer persistence, produce elegant solutions that can also be applied to machine designs.

technologies.name: Interstellar Fleet Traditions
technologies.description: A body of knowledge regarding combat behaviors is useless without a strong code governing its use.

technologies.name: Refit Standards
technologies.description: Standardizing workflows for upgrading and retrofitting ship components can lead to massive efficiency gains.

technologies.name: Command Matrix
technologies.description: Restructuring the chain of command and deciding what interdependencies are set between officers, make fleets more responsive and effective.

technologies.name: New Worlds Protocol
technologies.description: Calculating required resources and gear required to establish a planetary colony allows us to herd brave pioneers into grand "ark ships," confident that they will survive the long voyage across the stars to a new home.

technologies.name: Dangerous Wildlife Removal
technologies.description: Tactical disruption of natural habitats combined with converging search-and-destroy patterns can effectively eliminate hostile wildlife in a very short span of time.

technologies.name: Planetary Resurfacing
technologies.description: With the advent of clean fusion, automation, and matter compression technologies, it was only a matter of time before mountain top removal became mountain range removal.

technologies.name: Terrestrial Sculpting
technologies.description: There is no simple solution to the problem of macro-scale reshaping of planetary crusts - only bigger trowels and orbitally-deployed drills.

technologies.name: Climate Restoration
technologies.description: By advancing our understanding of atmospheric transformation, we will be able to terraform even the most ecologically devastated worlds.

technologies.name: Ecological Adaptation
technologies.description: By adapting planetary ecosystems to large-scale environmental changes we can turn terraformation into a less disruptive process.

technologies.name: Deep Crust Engineering
technologies.description: Advances in material technology and deep-shaft mining techniques allow geo-engineering at previously unthinkable depths and temperatures. Magma hotspots can now be exploited, suppressed, or even relocated.

technologies.name: Ocean Ecology Management
technologies.description: Given enough processing power, networked sensors and distributed stations, even the ocean currents can be managed to a fine level of control.

technologies.name: Soil Remediation
technologies.description: The process of soil deposition normally takes millions of years. With advanced fracking, chemical engineering, and hydraulic management technologies even the poorest substrate can be turned into fertile topsoil.

technologies.name: Selective Defoliants
technologies.description: Thorough cataloging, gene sequencing, and computer modeling of exobotanical ecosystems, coupled with gene editing and dispersal mechanisms, will allow us to reshape alien plant communities to our liking.

technologies.name: Xeno-Hydraulic Mastery
technologies.description: Sapient races have been reclaiming swampland for thousands of years. A coordinated system of modular aquaducts, pump stations, chemical remediation crawlers and automated soil compactors can reclaim land at unprecedented speeds.

technologies.name: Climate Control Network
technologies.description: Orbital systems of mirrors and shades can effect dramatic changes in planetary climates, when managed properly.

technologies.name: Subterranean Colonization
technologies.description: Many planets exhibit extensive subsurface voids. Subterranean exploration, exploitation, and construction techniques can greatly increase the habitable area of some worlds.

technologies.name: Atmospheric Filtering
technologies.description: By adjusting atmospheric filtering on a per-site basis to better filter out undesirable elements, colonial living conditions may be improved.

technologies.name: Hostile Environment Adaptation
technologies.description: Further study into the hazardous environments found on other planets help alleviate the difficulties that colonizers encounter in their day-to-day lives on foreign worlds.

technologies.name: Tomb World Adaptation
technologies.description: Through comprehensive study of irradiated environments we will allow our settlers to colonize worlds that have been devastated by nuclear warfare.

technologies.name: Foreign Soil Enrichment
technologies.description: Extensive study into different soil types and their ability to support crops will help improve the living conditions of our settlers on foreign worlds.

technologies.name: Eco-Integration Studies
technologies.description: Additional study into different planetary climates will allow us to settle our population on worlds previously thought too hostile to support them.

technologies.name: Stellar Expansion
technologies.description: Our future lies in the sea of stars.

technologies.name: Interstellar Expansion
technologies.description: The immense logistical support networks needed to maintain an upgraded Starbase can be further improved, allowing us to support more of these stations.

technologies.name: Manifest Destiny
technologies.description: We must have to courage to seize our fate and make true what was always meant to be.

technologies.name: Interstellar Campaigns
technologies.description: A well-oiled war machine is the key to exerting influence on a galactic scale. Backed by the might of our military, we can lay claim to almost anything we want.

technologies.name: Galactic Campaigns
technologies.description: Further improvements to administration grant an extended power projection across the stars, and the military clout needed to enforce our demands.

technologies.name: Psionic Theory
technologies.description: The mind is in many ways a reflection of the universe itself, a microcosmos. All species may not reach this insight, but their minds are tools greater than any other.

technologies.name: Zro Distillation
technologies.description: An extremely rare aerosol of exotic particles. It has been deposited on a number of worlds through meteor impacts, but its true origin is a mystery. If ingested by psionically-gifted individuals, Zro acts as a very potent (and addictive) drug that enhances Psi abilities.

technologies.name: Telepathy
technologies.description: Once fully adapted to the basics of Psionics, the mind is capable of connecting to other individuals, becoming something greater.

technologies.name: Thought Enforcement
technologies.description: Telepaths can monitor the citizenry for incorrect thoughts, but with some study they could also correct thought abberations that they find.

technologies.name: Precognition Interface
technologies.description: Advances in the field of Psionics suggest the possibility of creating combat computers capable of reading and analysing the impulses of telepathic operatives before they are cognitively processed.

technologies.name: Psi Jump Drive
technologies.description: The Psi Jump Drive harnesses the psi energies emitted by the crew to force the vessel through the very fabric of reality, instantly "jumping" vast distances.

technologies.name: Synaptic Structures
technologies.description: Through the development of macroscopic synaptic nodes, the will of the Hive will be strengthened.

technologies.name: Clustered Synapses
technologies.description: By clustering networks of macroscopic synaptic nodes, maximum meganeuron transmission per available surface area can be attained.

technologies.name: Confluence of Thought
technologies.description: The will of the Hive will be further strengthened and coordinated with the expansion and development of a massive nervous center of meganeurons.

technologies.name: Holo-Entertainment
technologies.description: Pioneering use of holographic technology allows for the creation of artificial environments that seem as authentic as the real world. It is the next step of immersive entertainment.

technologies.name: Hyper-Entertainment Forum
technologies.description: These massive entertainment complexes is where dreams come true. Shopping malls, restaurants, amusement parks, virtual arcades, and more. You dream it - we are it!

technologies.name: Planetary Government
technologies.description: Once a colony has been firmly established and pioneers turn into citizens, the need for a strong local government providing stability trumps the colonial need for flexibility.

technologies.name: Planetary Unification
technologies.description: Ancient warring tribes, historical nations in conflict, now unified in empire. We must not, will not, crumble.

technologies.name: Improved Production
technologies.description: As our planets become more developed, we can gain significant improvements to our throughput.

technologies.name: Efficiencies of Scale
technologies.description: Increased population density gives us an opportunity to further increase productivity.

technologies.name: Maximized Productivity
technologies.description: Continued advancements in technology allow our most developed planets to reach productivity levels unheard of in earlier times.

technologies.name: Adaptive Bureaucracy
technologies.description: The progress we make calls for a new, nimbler form of administration that may aid rather than hinder us in our pursuits.

technologies.name: Effective Bureaucracy
technologies.description: Improved algorithms for processing and organizing vast amounts of data has streamlined decision-making and information-sharing throughout the empire.

technologies.name: Colonial Bureaucracy
technologies.description: Local administrative developments allow for closer supervision of colonial affairs without excessively burdening central decision-making.

technologies.name: Galactic Bureaucracy
technologies.description: Multiple administrative strata efficiently surface only the most vital information to the upper levels of government.

technologies.name: Administrative Efficiency
technologies.description: Restructuring the managerial web linking core worlds to the capital can help alleviate the administrative stressors and information chokepoints that frequently arise within a budding empire.

technologies.name: Colonial Centralization
technologies.description: Robust frameworks for local governance created on a per-case basis, to meet each colony's needs.

technologies.name: Galactic Markets
technologies.description: By engaging in free trade of goods and services we allow for a more specialized economy, where an individual can excel in a narrow field and trade for their needs.

technologies.name: The Collective Self
technologies.description: Finding aspects of the self within the group is natural and inevitable; eventually those shared aspects must be valued higher than individual identities.

technologies.name: Galactic Administration
technologies.description: The administrative needs of a star empire are as numerous as they are complex. We will rise to the occasion.

technologies.name: Automated Curation Algorithms
technologies.description: Continuous, asynchronous analysis of disparate data sets allows for the accurate modeling of hitherto-unpredictable fluctuations in social currents.

technologies.name: Global Production Strategy
technologies.description: Planets are big and production sites are often separated by vast distances. A coherent strategy for making certain that everyone is pulling in the same direction is often needed.

technologies.name: The Living State
technologies.description: The Empire lives, the Empire breathes. We may make up its body, but it is not for the left hand to know what the right hand is doing.

technologies.name: Autonomous Agents
technologies.description: Semi-independent units have proved critical to the success of the greater whole.

technologies.name: Embodied Dynamism
technologies.description: Initiative and some measure of ambition must be promoted in our autonomous leader units, while still making certain that they do not stray too far from the directives of the core intelligence.

technologies.name: Xeno Diplomacy
technologies.description: Advancing our understanding of interactions with - and manipulations of - the xeno is a necessary step in forming more permanent interstellar alliances.

technologies.name: Xeno Relations
technologies.description: The complexities of interstellar diplomacy necessitate the forming of bonds with foreign powers in order to further one's goals.

technologies.name: Ceramo-Metal Infrastructure
technologies.description: Stronger alloys allow us to create prefabricated buildings, providing our colonies with the improved infrastructure.

technologies.name: Durasteel Infrastructure
technologies.description: Advances in metallurgy permit us to build vastly larger and more durable structures, greatly improving the infrastructure of our colonies.

technologies.name: Interplanetary Commerce
technologies.description: With new planetary markets comes new opportunities for commerce. Business will be booming.

technologies.name: Offworld Trade Companies
technologies.description: Trade across interstellar distances presents a new set of challenges to overcome. It is critical to achieve the transfer of goods from one system to another in a timely and above all cost efficient manner.

technologies.name: Interstellar Economics
